div.pre: 2378 Bouches-du-Rhône, near l'Étang de (887) Berre, 1834 Burial: 2nd cent. B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 600 AR Massalia: 500-600 (ob. ?) Gallic: 20+ AR (inc. Avenio, Caenicenses, monnaies-à-la-croix) Roman Rep.: 1 den. Disposition: unknown Marquis de Lagoy, Description de quelques mon- naies inédites de Massalia etc. (Aix, 1834), pp. 25, 29 and note 1 Baron Chaudruc de Crazannes, RN 1839, p. 167 Allotte de la Fuÿe, Tourdan, pp. 50-1 Blanchet, Traité, p. 545, no. 26 Allen, NC 1969, p. 66, no. 26 This hd., it is clear, did not contain the archaic coins also described by Lagoy (op. cit.); these were analogous to the types of the Auriol hoard and were not from a hd. but from excavations at St.-Rémy (anc. Glanum), cf. Babelon Traité II.1, p. 1578. The Massalia coins in the present hd. were never described
